definition: variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to be unable to express oneself clearly (idiom)

sentences.english: The principle of orality is established as a basic principle in modern civil Procedural law.
sentences.chinese: 言词原则是近代民事诉讼法确立的一项重要原则。

sentences.english: His word finally foment her hostility.
sentences.chinese: 他的言词终于引发了她的敌意。

sentences.english: His words finally fomented her hostility .
sentences.chinese: 他的言词终于引发了她的敌意。

sentences.english: And babble the same speech without need of meaning...
sentences.chinese: 不用含意却絮叨相同的言词。

sentences.english: The literati almost all agree on establishing the Principle of Directness and Verbalism in China.
sentences.chinese: 学界对于直接言词原则的确立基本都持肯定的态度。

sentences.english: Spread his word for non-believers left on earth.
sentences.chinese: 散布他的言词，使得非信徒离开地球。

sentences.english: Non-verbal, because it does not involve the use of words.
sentences.chinese: 之所以称之为非言语交际，是因为它不涉及言词。

sentences.english: Our speech is an expression of our faith.
sentences.chinese: 我们的言词是我们信仰的一种表述。
不要相信他那伪善的言词。

sentences.english: Never be afraid to test yourself by your critic's words.
sentences.chinese: 千万不用害怕接受尖酸刻薄言词的考验。

sentences.english: Savants of Europe have found in his words the ring of universal truth.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲专家发现了他的言词包围着宇宙真理。

sentences.english: Bound with all the weight of all the words he tried to say.
sentences.chinese: 他试著说出被䌸上重担的言词，所有的。

sentences.english: The age for Uighur beginning to learn Chinese is important in affecting the use of Chinese dialect words.
sentences.chinese: 开始学习汉语的时间也影响汉语方言词的使用。

sentences.english: Today before you say an unkind word - Think of someone who can't speak.
sentences.chinese: 当你想要说刺人的言词时，想想还有人不能讲话。

sentences.english: The messenger of the god, spread his word for non-believers left on earth.
sentences.chinese: 上帝的信使，散布他的言词，使得非信徒离开地球。

sentences.english: He was gifted, on occasion, with a gentle raillery.
sentences.chinese: 他一有机会，总爱说一些温和的讥诮言词。

definition: wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
words and actions/what one says and what one does
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
